Bootloader Development

The bootloader is the first code executed after the computer starts. Its main task is to load the operating system kernel into memory and transfer control to it.

Types of Bootloaders:

  • Custom bootloader in assembly (16-bit real mode)
  • Multiboot compliant bootloader, e.g., GRUB

Key Concepts:

  • Disk structure and MBR
  • Transition from real mode to protected mode
  • Loading binary files into memory

A popular approach is to use GRUB, which supports the multiboot standard and simplifies loading custom kernels.
